intro: Compsoa macropoda, commonly known as the large-seeded compsoa, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are ovate and hairy, with a rough texture. Compsoa macropoda is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, thriving in moist, well-drained soils.
